intro: Tarrietia argyrodendron var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved silverwood, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, waxy hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
